journals.notes: Above model is part of pak0 and unused.

Also, something I never understood, is that some content in the final game, like the little generator at the bottom of the stairs near the Gun on Battery doesn't exist in game files, both model AND texture; That's why you need to download the RtCW extra content, and include the texture to have it working with your map o.o

Maybe these could be included in pak3.pk3?

Mateos wrote:
> Maybe these could be included in pak3.pk3?
I do not think it is a good idea... Because if you make a map which "takes" textures and models from ET:L's pak3, people using vanilla ET will only see missing models/textures...

By the way, shouldn't this entry (issue) be a part of the wiki?
user:IR4T4: could you please provide more information about this? We cannot change the contents of original paks, so what is the purpose of this bug report?

As the title says. If we ever ever ever create own pak0-2 files we shouldn't add unused models, textures etc. 

But we have both ways: missing and unused assets

Therefore I have updated the wiki see  ET & ET:Legacy tech -> Mapping & Textures so we can file it in the wiki instead of creating tickets.

I know some models which are not present, may I post them?

For instance the tools you have on the table in the first Axis spawn in Railgun, or the generator near the North AT-Gun on Oasis (Same near the Seawall gun) :)

They were available through a SVN as Wolf Pack and ET Pack (Some RtCW stuff was in ET but not in the package); The address is "dead" (SVN Update fails with the related error); Old adress:
http://zerowing.idsoftware.com

Yes, please do. Update the wiki page that user:IR4T4 set up:

IR4T4 wrote:
> See http://www.etlegacy.com/projects/etlegacy/wiki/Mapping_and_Textures

I agree that a wiki page is better to track this stuff instead of a bug report.. until we start replacing pak0.pk3
Mateos feel free to add any info to the wiki ... it's much appreciated. We may also add missing assets ... just open an issue. This ET Pack sounds interesting ;)
